com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveGroupListIf

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<XhiveGroupIf>
public interface XhiveGroupListIf
extends java.lang.Iterable<XhiveGroupIf>

Collects XhiveGroupIf objects in a list.

All groups of a XhiveDatabaseIf object are stored in the XhiveGroupListIf.
The names of XhiveGroupIf objects are unique within the scope of the list.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

Method Detail

getGroup

XhiveGroupIf getGroup(java.lang.String groupname)
Get the XhiveGroupIf interface matching the supplied group name.

Group names are unique in a XhiveGroupListIf, so only one group can match the supplied group name.

Parameters:
groupname - the group name.
Returns:
the XhiveGroupIf with given group name. If no such object exists, the return value is null.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

iterator

java.util.Iterator<XhiveGroupIf> iterator()
Gets an iterator for iterating over the groups in this list.

Objects returned by this iterator should be casted to the XhiveGroupIf interface.

Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<XhiveGroupIf>
Returns:
The group iterator.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

addGroup

XhiveGroupIf addGroup(java.lang.String groupname)
Creates a new XhiveGroupIf object with group name and adds it to the list.

Only the administrator or super user can add a group to the XhiveGroupListIf group list. By using the addGroup() method, the group is added to the XhiveGroupListIf group list.

Parameters:
groupname - the name of the new group.
Returns:
A new XhiveGroupIf object with given groupname.
Throws:
GROUP_ALREADY_EXISTS - when a group with the same group name already belongs to the group list.
ACCESS_DENIED - when a user other than the administrator or super user tries to add a group.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

removeGroup

void removeGroup(XhiveGroupIf group)

Removes a group and all its occurences from the database.

Only the administrator or super user can remove a group from the group list.

Parameters:
group - the group that is to be removed from the XhiveGroupListIf group list.
Throws:
ACCESS_DENIED - when a user other than the administrator or super user tries to remove the group.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

hasGroup

boolean hasGroup(java.lang.String groupname)
Returns true when the group with given group name belongs to the XhiveGroupListIf group list.

Parameters:
groupname - the name of the group.
Returns:
true when the group with given group name belongs to the XhiveGroupListIf group list.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

size

int size()
Returns the number of XhiveGroupIf objects in the group list.

Returns:
The number of XhiveGroupIf objects in the group list.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0
